betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Hello Player and welcome to §aGregtech - Other Worlds§f! This pack is made as a collaborative effort of the GTOW team, and credit is given to each member of the team on the packs main page.
This modpack is made mostly off the mod §e§eGregtech Community Edition Unofficial§0§0§f and so there is some expertise of Gregtech recommended, however players of all skill levels can still enjoy the pack!
Check the box to begin playing!

§4§cSleeping has been disabled in this pack, §fyou should keep this in mind before having your entire base be above the ground and blown up by a stray creeper.
Take a night vision potion for your troubles, you're sure to need it.

You may notice that you have less hearts than usual, that's intended. This pack has §eSpice of Life §fand that means §ayour health can be increased from eating a variety of foods.
§f§cBe warned! Eating too much of the same food in a row may have negative consequences...
You've gone through most of this song and dance before, break some trees and get some wood.
Crafting Tables are not attainable yet, so you must use the Basic Worktable. §d§a§aThis can only craft recipes that can be made in a basic worktable §f§aand some recipes §amay take tools to complete.
Your first tools will not be wood or stone, they must be flint. Flint will not naturally drop from gravel, §ayou have to craft it into flint shards.

There are many plants and species of flora in this world, you should grab some of the most important resources you can from them.
You obtain §awildroot, seeds and plant fibers §ffrom §ebreaking grass, §fand §astring §fcan be obtained from §eflax plants.

The §aFlint Hatchet §fdoesn't actually have much use as a hatchet, but it is an important beginner crafting item. There's two recipes for it, one in a worktable and one in a crafting table. §cYou can only use the worktable recipe.§f
Additionally, the §aflint file§f will also end up being used in early recipes. There are also other flint tools that will have to be made, but those will come up when they have to, and they're all exceedingly simple to craft.

The §b§e§aArtisan's Flint Hatchet§f is only good at crafting, for chopping down actual trees it's rather bad. Make a §aFlint Hatchet §fthat is far better at doing that.
It has a small durability, so to repair it you can make §aFlint Sharpening Kits

For better tools, you are going to need §aactual flint, §fno more dinky flint shards. The way that you can get flint is by §emortaring gravel...§f No not the silly gregtech recipe! The one in §eartisans worktables.
§fFlint will become a very useful asset in the future, so stock up on some gravel.

With a §achopping block §fand §aflint hatchet§f in hand, you can now go and chip chop your way to some §e§b§awooden planks!
§fThe chopping block is an §ein world crafting station,§f when you place a log on it with right clock it will appear on the stump. Hitting the chopping block with right click using your axe will slowly break apart the log, eventually returning planks!
The Flint Hatchet returns §conly two planks for each log.
To get planks, you'll need a §achopping block.§f It's nothing more than a log with a hatchet
With your newfound planks, you can make §achests§f with ease! Finally a place to put all those seeds...
The time of using your hands is over, you can make a §aflint pickaxe and shovel§f now!
I don't know what else to say here. Grab §acobblestone.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Light That Fire Up In The Night
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The §acampfire§f is an essential tool in any plane of survival. It can cook and is a most invaluable light source, especially in a world so dark.
To make it, §bplace tinder on the ground and click on it with logs to surround it (8 Logs is the max), then use the flint and tinder on the campfire for it to be lit.§f Tada! A perfect campfire!
The logs will slowly disappear after some time, so you'll have to end up replenishing them by clicking on it again.

§aTinder §fis a handy combination of §edry plant fibers and sticks§f that can be used as a very flammable material.
Also, you should try to find some §b§ewheat to make straw. §fIt's a easier way of making it, but it's far from required.

With your newfound chopping stump and wooden planks, you should attempt to make a §adrying rack. §fIt allows you to turn §eplant fibers into dry plant fibers,§f which is a more consistent source of twine.
§fIt also will be necessary for making paper later on.
Not able to find §e§benough spare flax? §fNeed some §bwheat to turn into straw? §fJust start farming! §aMattock§f is a simple craft, and there's not really anything more to it.

The §aPit Kiln§f is a way to fire up objects early on, it can be used to make §eclay tools§f and it can §esmelt cobblestone into stone. §fYou'll end up using both of these.
To use it, §bplace down the kiln in the ground and then place the object you want to fire on top of it. Cover it with a Straw Bale and then place wood on top of it.§f Lighting it on fire will start the process of burning the item.
§bThe Pit Kiln must be surrounded on all sides for it to work.

§dTip! You should run around 6 to 8 of these things this early on. Before you get stone machines it's the only way to make smooth stone or clay tools. If you're feeling cheap however, make just enough for a stone kiln and make the rest of your smooth stone using that.

The §aGranite Anvil§f is an item that can be used to break down stone blocks. It is used to make §estone slabs and mason bricks.
§fThe Stone and Stone Slabs can be fired in a pit kiln, §c§bcobblestone slabs must be crafted using the worktable recipe.

§aMason brick§f are a vital component in your earliest of early machines. It allows for the Workstation to be crafting, and allows for §estone inventions§f to be made.
To make mason bricks, you have to §ebreak stone brick slabs on an anvil using a pickaxe. §fStone bricks must be made in a worktable using a artisan chisel.

§bWant to carry fluids? Want to defend your house?§f You need to get into pottery.
Making §aunfired bricks§f are fairly easy, §ethey take clay and a wooden form.§f You can then fire them in a kiln of some kind and get the properly fired version of it.
Make §aa clay bucket,§f you'll need it eventually.

§dJust because this quest takes only the pit quest does not mean you need to do it right now, you can also make the clay buckets in the stone kiln and doing it after the stone machines quest is completely possible.

The §abasic workstation§f is an important crafting station that allows the use of §btwo artisan tools in order to craft an item.
§f§bIt can do all of the recipes a regular worktable can do,§f but now has storage for tools and can accept two tools for a single recipe.
Most masonry and stone machines take two tools to craft, so this is used a lot.

The §aStone Kiln, Stone Oven, and Stone Sawmill§f are slightly more efficient versions of their non-stone counterparts. They are powered by §e§b§eburning logs or other fuels in their lower slot.
§fOn top of the standard recipes, they also have some special recipes that can §eonly be made in improved versions of the machines.
§fFor this quest you'll craft §ball three of them,§f don't worry, you will use them all. Additionally it also has you get a §aflint sawblade§f for the sawmill.

The §aCharcoal Pit§f is a §bmultiblock §ffrom Pyrotech that will turn §c§e§blog piles into charcoal, §famong other things.
It works fairly similarly to the §echarcoal pit from Forestry,§f if you've ever used it. §bAll sides have to be surrounded by dirt/grass except for the bottom, which can be stone drains.
§fLight one of the top logs and then cover it with dirt or grass again and wait, if you did it right §e§bthe structure should continue smoking.§f Once it has stopped smoking you are able to open it again and §ebreak the ash,§f leaving you with charcoal.
§eStone basins at the bottom can collect fluid from the process.§f Namely §awood tar, §fwhich can be used later.
All of the ingredients here will be required for a good multiblock, §bthe wood log count can be increased though.

§dIt has to be log piles, regular logs wont do. Drains only pull out from collecters in a 3x3 area behind them. If you do not have fluid storage you can pull wood tar straight out of the drain and/or collectors.

§aSugarcane §fis a valuable crop that can be used to satisfy your sweet tooth or, more importantly, §ecraft paper§f.
You'll want a lot of Sugarcane soon enough, so start growing it early!

Tired of having to constantly replace your flint tools? You can make §amasons tools! §fThey have §emore durability §fand you can craft most of the same tools as you can flint tools.
Some mason tools you still can't make, however.
§aBoards §fare durable, lightweight, applications of wood. They are essential for many constructs and are gotten from §esawing wooden slabs.

§aWood Tar§f is a byproduct of running the charcoal pit, it can be a useful crafting component for strengthening certain wood materials.
§dThis Wood Tar may look different, but it's the exact same

§aPaper§f is a versatile ingredient with many properties. Because of this omniusability, it's not going to be easy to make.
The first goal is to get §echad §fby mortaring some sugar cane. You then must §esoak it in a water pot for several minutes.§f Once you have the soaked chad you can combine it into §epulp.§f §aPulp is then dried into paper.
§fIt's not an especially difficult process, however you will need a lot of chad for the paper§f, so make sure to have ample amounts of sugarcane.

Welcome to the world of fluid crafting! The §aSoaking Pot §fallows you to soak items in it for some time in order for them to §eturn into different items.
§fThe liquids you'll be using early on are mostly going to be water and wood tar, so the §bbucket will not be breaking.
§fKeep in mind that water is finite in the pack.

Make some §adurable string or tarred boards/anything else with wood tar§f to complete this quest.
In order to soak these items correctly, you have to §bplace the soaking pot above a campfire, §fother than that it's the same.
§d
§dOnly the Tarred Planks, Boards, and String are used much, don't worry about the rest. You only need any one of these items.

Finally, now that you have paper, you can make §ablank patterns §ffor §eTinker's Construct§f!
Patterns do have some other uses too, but you'll mostly need them for stencils and the like. §bYou should probably make a sugar cane farm for that. These get expensive.

With your newfound patterns, you can make the §atables from tinker's construct!§f These allow you to make some invaluable §ecrafting components §ffor further on.
§bWhere's the tool station you ask? Don't worry about that silly thing!

The §aArtisan's workshop§f is a 5x5 artisan table that can use three tools, blah blah, we don't care about that. The good thing about the Basic Workshop is that it can craft §eactual normal crafting table recipes.
§fEvery other artisan's worktable is unable to craft recipes from the normal §lCrafting§f JEI tab. The Basic Workshop is not limited by that, and you are §efree to craft whatever you'd like.
§fAlso some future things may require the §e5x5 grid or the three tools,§f i.e. Refractory stuff.

For your regular selection of tools, you're going to be using gregtech ones. Your first set of GT tools you can make for general usage are §aflint tools.§f
Your previous flint tools are Tinker's flint tools, which do work, however, they do not have the §ecorrect harvest level to mine any ore.§c You have to use gregtech.

So, you're able to mine now ay? Well Mining is a little bit different here, so let's get into that.
First off, §aonly Gregtech ores spawn.§f There's no minecraft ores, no mekanism ores, just gregtech. And gregtech doesn't do regular ore veins. No it has §b§aore VEINS.§f
Each vein is often around two chunks wide with hundreds of ores in each. These veins have up to four types of ores: primary, seconday, between, and sporadic. Basically upper layers are primary and bottom layers are secondary.
Each vein spawns every three chunks. To find out where a vein is take the X and Z chunk coordinate (i.e. the chunk you are in on the chunk grid) and if both values are a multiple of 3n+1, it's an ore vein.
Good luck digging!

The §aGregtech Mortar§f is basically just a better version of the artisan's mortar. It can make chad, sugar, and clay dust as well as §emaking flint for only one gravel instead of three.
§fThe §aGregtech Hammer and File §fare other Gregtech tools that will also be used for crafting eventually, you can make the hammer out of §eMasonry Bricks and the file out of large stone plates§f. There is also a §amining hammer§f, made from large stone plates, that mines in a 3x3 area.

Your next goal is to get §aglass,§f which is a somewhat investive endeavor.
In order to make glass you must §esmelt glassy sand in a kiln (not pit). §fGlassy sand is made with two glass dust and two sand. The Glass dust is made with quartz sand (ground up sand) and small piles of flint.

§dBecause of the chance for failure, make a few of these at a time. Kilns can run up to 16 items at once.

You have been missing one stone machine for too long, the §astone crucible! §fThis will allow you to melt things using the power of hotness.
It takes a lot of mason bricks and some newly obtainable glass to craft.

You have unlocked the secrets of the craft, no longer can you merely just work with mason tools, you have become a true mason. You understand stone like it's a living creature... maybe it is one?
You have unlocked the skill to craft the §amason's workshop. §fUse it wisely.

Do you have a lot of clay balls? Do you not know what to do with them? Fear not, the §acompacting bin §fwill save you! §eJust by putting they clay into the bin and hitting it with a shovel you can get clay blocks!§f Efficiency!

With your bloomery, you can now turn §ecopper into a §a§ebloom, §fbreaking it on a granite anvil with a bloom hammer will allow you to get copper! §aIn... nugget form.§f
Wait? You want copper ingots? §bIt's gonna take a bit more than that to do it...

The §aBloomery§f is the first way of smelting any ores, and it is baaaaaad at it.
It requires the ore (or dust) to be placed into the §btop first, and then fuel put on top of that. You then light the top on fire and it starts. §fIt is verrrrrrrry slow, however can be sped up using §abellows §fplaced next to it.
Once it's finished you will get a bloom. This bloom should be §bpicked up with tongs and then placed onto an anvil,§f where you can then smash it with a §abloom hammer (like the mason one) §fgetting §eslag, nuggets, and dust in the process.§f
Be careful! The bloom is very hot and may start a fire!

betterquesting:10.name:8: Bricks, Bricks, Bricks, and more Bricks!
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Further technology? Well guess how we'll get that, we need more and more bricks! For the next bit of progression we'll be using §aseared and refractory bricks,§f so grab yourself both of those!
The recipes both take fluids, and so can §conly be made in the basic workshop.§f Both take clay dust, which can be gotten from mortaring clay blocks. §eYou can make clay blocks with a compacting bin or in a workshop as well.

Finally finding the tools to mine, you set off, and look for the ores you can utilize... Of which there is basically only one. Yep, for even minor progression onwards you need to get §acopper.§f
Don't fret! Copper is not a rare metal at all, in fact there are §equite a few sources for it!§f §bAll of them can be turned into copper ingots with no processing, but some are easier to find than others.§f
I'd recommend finding a source of §dchalcopyrite or tetrahedrite.

To make refractory machines, we're going to need a strong and durable material to help keep the bricks together. You need §aRefractory Mortar
§fCombining §edark ash which can be made from slag and some other miscellaneous dusts§f, you can get a blend which when thrown into water will make a durable foundation material for further refractory machines.

Foundrys take molds, so let's make some §amolds.
§fTo start off, you'll need a §e§amold crafting station,§f with that you can then craft some refractory clay blocks and put them in along with some fuel. §eMake it into a certain shape and then fire it.
§fOnce you have your raw ingot mold, you'll want to place it into a §acast§f. Another easy recipe.

Well, you now have copper nuggets, let's turn those into ingots.
You cannot just manually combine copper nuggets into an ingot, that's dumb, you need to melt it and then cast it into an ingot. For this you'll need a§a Foundry§f.
Place the §aburner heater§f down and then place a §amelting crucible§f on top of it. §eStick a fuel into the burner heater and your nuggets into the crucible. §fNext place a §arefractory spout§f to the side of the crucible and an§a ingot cast §fdirectly under it.
Congrats! You now have a foundry!
Make some§a copper §fwith your newfound Foundry!

The Start of Gregtech - Other Worlds. A new adventure awaits! In a hostile, yet gentile world.

This will get you acquantinced with most of the earlygame, and will set you up with your initial metals and machines.
